{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3496238,"name":"","username":"Condorave","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T01:26:44.562Z","cooked":"

I hope you all are having a great build season so far! My team designed an elevator this year that hinged off of West Coast Products Elevator Clamping Blocks (1" Width, #10-32 Tapped). These have been out of stock for a few weeks, and we found out that our back ordered ones will not arrive until mid-late feb which is much too late, as we can not test or tune our robot until we have them. If your team purchased extra for their elevator this year or if you have extra from previous years we would like to buy them from you. Thank you so much!!!

For Vex V5 VRC 2024 2025 high steaks?

No we’re competing in FRC, I don’t think these bearing blocks would be the best choice for a VEX bot given their size and weight.

Unfortunately, it’s unlikely that anyone will have spares that they are willing to part with. You may have to redesign your elevator with different bearing blocks. Every major supplier has some version of bearing blocks (Rev, thrifty, etc.) Here’s some links.

Elevator Bearing Blocks - REV Robotics

MAXLift Bearing Blocks

Billet Elevator Bearing Block – Swerve Drive Specialties

These aren’t clamping blocks, but those are sold out pretty much everywhere.

We had looked at other bearing blocks, but none of them hold the stages the same distance apart as the WCP ones we designed with, it would have required a quite significant redesign to switch. We found a local team willing to let us use their clamping bearing blocks from last year. If we didn’t already have a relationship with this team I agree that it would have been hard to get them, as its quite an expensive item to loan out.
